entry.title: Meeting Time Poll for Spring 2020
entry.summary:
Welcome back everyone!

With the start of a new semester, we have to once again agree on a meeting time. As usual, we will meet for one hour each Friday at some time around noon. Please indicate your availability using the when2meet poll.

You do not need to create an …
entry.content:
Welcome back everyone!

With the start of a new semester, we have to once again agree on a meeting time. As usual, we will meet for one hour each Friday at some time around noon. Please indicate your availability using the when2meet poll.

You do not need to create an account, just login with your name and mark all slots in green that work for you.

entry.title: No Meeting on November 22
entry.summary: Since nobody is on the schedule to present this week, there will be no meeting. This works out in your favor if you're looking forward to attending Prof. Brian Kernighan's language seminar. I wish you all a good next couple of weeks!
entry.content: Since nobody is on the schedule to present this week, there will be no meeting. This works out in your favor if you're looking forward to attending Prof. Brian Kernighan's language seminar. I wish you all a good next couple of weeks!

entry.title: Gary on Truth
entry.summary: This Friday, Gary will be discussing whether Tarski’s Theory of Truth has been superceded by subsequent work using truth-value gaps such as those by Robert L. Martin, Bas van Fraassen, and especially Kripke’s "Outline of a Theory of Truth" (available in the Google Drive as Kripke1975.pdf). Hope …
entry.content: This Friday, Gary will be discussing whether Tarski’s Theory of Truth has been superceded by subsequent work using truth-value gaps such as those by Robert L. Martin, Bas van Fraassen, and especially Kripke’s "Outline of a Theory of Truth" (available in the Google Drive as Kripke1975.pdf). Hope to see you all there!

entry.title: Jeff on the TWinning Property
entry.summary: Hello everyone! Tomorrow, Jeff will be talking about the twinning property, which I am told characterizes deterministic functions. Hope to see you all there!
entry.content: Hello everyone! Tomorrow, Jeff will be talking about the twinning property, which I am told characterizes deterministic functions. Hope to see you all there!

entry.title: Dakotah on a TSL learner
entry.summary: Tomorrow Dakotah will be discussing a way to modify a typical SP learner to account for TSL stringsets. Any feedback would be appreciated, on topics from the algorithm itself to the types of things that should be discussed when presenting a Gold-style learner. Hope to see you all there!
entry.content: Tomorrow Dakotah will be discussing a way to modify a typical SP learner to account for TSL stringsets. Any feedback would be appreciated, on topics from the algorithm itself to the types of things that should be discussed when presenting a Gold-style learner. Hope to see you all there!

entry.title: Jon on subregular n-languages and -functions.
entry.summary: Tomorrow, Jon will be continuing his talk from a few weeks ago on subregular n-functions. Things have been updated some since the last time. The project is still developing, so Jon would appreciate any feedback you may have on the idea. Hope to see you all there!
entry.content: Tomorrow, Jon will be continuing his talk from a few weeks ago on subregular n-functions. Things have been updated some since the last time. The project is still developing, so Jon would appreciate any feedback you may have on the idea. Hope to see you all there!

entry.title: Aniello on MG Processing
entry.summary: Today Aniello will be talking about his research on modelling sentence processing with a top-down parser for Minimalist grammars. This is a practice talk, so we might go longer than usual. Hope to see you all there, and I'm sure Aniello is looking forward to your feedback.
entry.content: Today Aniello will be talking about his research on modelling sentence processing with a top-down parser for Minimalist grammars. This is a practice talk, so we might go longer than usual. Hope to see you all there, and I'm sure Aniello is looking forward to your feedback.

entry.title: No Meeting on Oct 11
entry.summary:
We're not meeting this week because of AMP. There's plenty of computational talks on the AMP program, and I encourage you all to attend those instead.

Next week, Oct 18, Aniello will give a practice talk in the reading group.
entry.content:
We're not meeting this week because of AMP. There's plenty of computational talks on the AMP program, and I encourage you all to attend those instead.

Next week, Oct 18, Aniello will give a practice talk in the reading group.
